commentary_data: Squad: Kyle Mayers, KL Rahul(c), Deepak Hooda, Marcus Stoinis, Krunal Pandya, Nicholas Pooran(w), Jaydev Unadkat, Mark Wood, Ravi Bishnoi, Avesh Khan, Amit Mishra, Ayush Badoni, Daniel Sams, Prerak Mankad, Swapnil Singh, Krishnappa Gowtham, Manan Vohra, Quinton de Kock, Naveen-ul-Haq, Yash Thakur, Romario Shepherd, Yudhvir Singh Charak, Karan Sharma, Mayank Yadav

Squad: Prabhsimran Singh, Shikhar Dhawan(c), Matthew Short, Bhanuka Rajapaksa, Jitesh Sharma(w), Sam Curran, Shahrukh Khan, Harpreet Brar, Rishi Dhawan, Kagiso Rabada, Arshdeep Singh, Rahul Chahar, Sikandar Raza, Harpreet Singh Bhatia,  Atharva Taide, Gurnoor Brar, Baltej Singh, Liam Livingstone, Vidhwath Kaverappa, Nathan Ellis, Mohit Rathee, Shivam Singh

Whisper it slowly but the Ekana Cricket Stadium is looking like a real fortress for LSG. They smashed Delhi on a red soil wicket and used spin to win against Sunrisers. Two thumping home wins, on two very different kinds of surfaces - always the sign of a team in full swing. And they head into this game full of confidence, after chasing down 212 against Bangalore in Bangalore in that thrilling contest. Their overseas batters Marcus Stoinis and Nicholas Pooran are firing, their bowlers are bowling full tilt. The only missing ingredient has been skipper KL Rahul getting some runs, maybe that too could happen today…

Opponents Punjab started the 2023 IPL season with two wins - the first time they won back-to-back since 2020. However, they have slumped to consecutive defeats now with a rather tepid batting performance in both those games. It has been a case of Shikhar Dhawan or bust for PBKS this season, with the odd contributions from Prabhsimran Singh and Bhanuka Rajapaksa. Their batting order needs to really push their weight now, and the potential inclusion of Liam Livingstone could do them a world of good. Bowling has been better for PBKS this season, especially death bowling but a little more from Kagiso Rabada and Rahul Chahar would be helpful. We’re not too far away from the toss, stick around for toss and team updates…. and of course the pitch report!
Early update from  who is at the venue suggests we have a patchy green pitch on offer today. Nathan Ellis and Romario Shepherd bowling on the side wickets at the moment.

The preparation is the same for me personally no matter what tournament. I believe in the processes that I’ve followed for the last 3-4 years. No difference in the way I prepare because I’ve played International cricket, because I believe I’ve played Internationals because of these processes. Personally, I prefer playing top-order like I have in domestic cricket but I like to play the situation more than the batting number.
Big update coming in from Lucknow,

It's hot but not too much wind. Short hit on the leg side, straight boundaries are the longest. This is a fresh wicket but it looks tired. It looks specky, some green patches but some very dry areas. It is a  expect the ball to come on better on this track.

We'll bowl first. Something we haven't done all season so just needed a change up. Also our first toss that we have won this season. Shilkhar picked up an injury last game, don't know how bad it is but hopefully he won't be out long. His absence is huge, we've got two Indian batters coming in and Raza is back in the XI. The conditions looks good

First game on this strip, anything would have worked. It is exciting to challenge ourselves on different conditions. It is our first season here, so each game we'll assess and modify. Every game we make a few changes, settle on a 12-13 and take a call depending on the game. Each game we have turned up and we have been challenged every time, but players have found answers. Everyone is enjoying the game and there is a good vibe around, really happy with the support we have got out here.
(Playing XI): Atharva Taide, Matthew Short, Harpreet Singh Bhatia, Sikandar Raza, Jitesh Sharma(w), Shahrukh Khan, Sam Curran(c), Harpreet Brar, Kagiso Rabada, Rahul Chahar, Arshdeep Singh
(Playing XI): KL Rahul(c), Kyle Mayers, Deepak Hooda, Marcus Stoinis, Krunal Pandya, Nicholas Pooran(w), Ayush Badoni, Avesh Khan, Yudhvir Singh Charak, Mark Wood, Ravi Bishnoi
Amit Mishra, Jaydev Unadkat, K Gowtham, Prerak Mankad, Daniel Sams
Prabhsimran Singh, Nathan Ellis, Mohit Rathee, Rishi Dhawan
Right, the LSG openers are out in the middle. A very inexperienced looking PBKS side, led by Sam Curran here. Let's see what they can do against one of the favourites of the competition....
Short to Rahul, 1 run, loopy delivery on middle, just a sighter for Rahul to push down to long-on and get going
Short to Mayers, no run, floated up nicely on middle, pushed back to the bowler
Short to Mayers, , off the mark with six!! This was on the pads and Mayers just lofts his sweep over deep backward square leg. That is the short boundary, saisl away for six!!
Short to Mayers, no run, some bite!! Flat and gets extra bounce outside off, Mayers had a poke and missed
Short to Mayers, no run, some bite!! Flat and gets extra bounce outside off, Mayers had a poke and missed
Using off-spin against Mayers, first tick under Sam Curran's captaincy..
Short to Mayers, no run, short and slightly wide, dabbed towards short third
Short to Mayers, no run, slow and short outside off, Mayers goes back to punch through covers but well stopped by the fielder diving to his right
Arshdeep Singh to Rahul, , short and wide, Rahul leant closer but decides to leave since it was too wide
Arshdeep Singh to Rahul, 1 run, full and gets a bit of swing onto middle, pushed towards mid-on for a quick single
Arshdeep Singh to Mayers, 1 run, good length on off, dabbed late to the left of short third for a single. Quick running again
Arshdeep Singh to Rahul, no run, full and slants away nicely from Rahul. Beaten trying to drive on the up...
Arshdeep Singh to Rahul, , on the pads and too full, very gently tickled to the right of short fine for a boundary
Arshdeep Singh to Rahul, no run, good length outside off, holds its line. No shot offered
Arshdeep Singh to Rahul, no run, very full outside off, Rahul drives but towards covers it goes
Rabada to Mayers, no run, good length and straight, slightly skiddy. Mayers gets in line to defend
Rabada to Mayers, , back of length and leaving the batter, Mayers goes back to punch and the ball flies off the outside edge for a boundary!!
Rabada to Mayers, 1 run, good length and wide, Mayers gets another flying edge on the punch. One bounce towards third-man
Rabada to Rahul, no run, back of length on off and really shoots up off the pitch. Surprises Rahul who cops a blow on his glove trying to defend

What's the logic behind Prabhsimran starting as a substitute if Atharv and Harpreet are in playing XI? And also plz tell why Nathan Ellis is sub. 'He can come in as a batter in the second innings. As for Ellis, every team can nominate a 5th overseas player as a substitute, he can then come and field if needed ( for an overseas player)

Rabada to Rahul, , up and over, classic KL Rahul!! Rabada steaming in at 140 clicks, bowls it fuller on off and Rahul just effortlessly lifts his drive over extra cover. Bounces once and goes after...
Rabada to Rahul, 1 run, full and skids on off, another flying edge towards third-man
In front of a side like LSG, which is full of international experience, it will be very interesting to see how young Sam Curran captains a rather inexperienced PBKS today.
Sam Curran to Rahul, 1 run, slower length ball on off, Rahul goes back and punches it towards the sweeper
Sam Curran to Mayers, no run, full and hurries Mayers slightly into defending towards mid-off
Sam Curran to Mayers, 1 run, back of length cutter, just outside off. Mayers waits and dabs it to the left of short third for a single
Sam Curran to Rahul, 1 run, fuller on off, Rahul with a smart tap and run towards covers
Sam Curran to Mayers, no run, very full on off, Mayers drives hard but straight to mid-off
Good to see LSG backing Mayers after his back to back failures.

Sam Curran to Mayers, , up and over for six!! A classic Kyle Mayers shot as Curran gives his width outside off and bowls it shorter. Mayers arches his back and punches it over covers and all the way for six. It was the cutter as well, so all power from Mayers on that. Most others who try that shot could have a back muscle pull, but when Kyle Mayers does it it goes for six...
Rabada to Rahul, no run, good length and angling to off, Rahul defends it behind square on the off side
Rabada to Rahul, 1 run, yorker length on off, another tap and run to covers
Rabada to Mayers, no run, yorker, Mayers almost beaten for pace but drags his bat down to push it towards mid-on
Rabada to Mayers, 2 runs, full and wide outside off, Mayers loves it there!! Clears his feet and slams it over the infield. Doesn't have the timing to get a boundary, two runs taken...

Rabada to Mayers, , what a shot!! The disrespect shown to a premier overseas bowler is almost commendable. This was short on the body at good pace, Mayers made room and pulls it high and handsomely into the stands beyond deep mid-wicket. He's beginning to take off again...
PBKS doesn't have the service of Bairstow, Livingston, Dhawan and Rajapaskha in this match! Literally, their best 4 batters!
Rabada to Mayers, no run, very full and quick on middle, Mayers gets a thick inside edge on his drive that takes the ball leg side
Harpreet Brar to Rahul, , too short with width, not the length you bowl in the powerplay. Rahul gets back and cuts it between covers and point for a boundary
Harpreet Brar to Rahul, 1 run, generous flight onto the pads, Rahul with a gentle push towards mid-wicket
Harpreet Brar to Mayers, 1 run, short and coming in with the arm to off, Mayers goes back and punches through extra cover. Half stopped by the fielder so just a single
Harpreet Brar to Rahul, no run, flighted up, driven straight to covers. First yes then no by Rahul, Mayers has to dive to get back in
Harpreet Brar to Rahul, 1 run, shorter length but straight line, Rahul gets back to punch it down to long-off
Harpreet Brar to Rahul, 1 run, shorter length but straight line, Rahul gets back to punch it down to long-off
Harpreet Brar to Mayers, no run, quicker onto middle and leg, Mayers pushes it down to mid-off.

Can sense Mayers playing with a lot more responsibility this IPL than he does even for WI (no disrespect). Yes one can argue that WI usually bat deep but could well be a case of de Kock sitting on the sidelines too. He knows that a couple of iffy games & he could well be warming the bench.
Off-spinner back with the field spread out. All a bait to get Mayers to play the big shot...
Short to Rahul, no run, fired quicker outside off, Rahul cuts it into the ground towards backward point
Short to Rahul, no run, pushed up and turning in from off, blocked towards mid-on
Short to Rahul, no run, flat onto the pads, turned to short fine. Another dot ball
Short to Rahul, 1 run, short and wide, cut square of the wicket for a single
Here's the match-up they wanted. Mayers vs off spin
Short to Mayers, 1 run, short of length, cut square of the wicket for another single
Short to Rahul, 1 run, flighted up, Rahul jams it into the ground towards long-on.
What happened to Dhawan? 'Curran said he picked up an injury during the last match'
Harpreet Brar to Rahul, 1 run, flighted up nicely on off, driven towards extra cover
Harpreet Brar to Mayers, no run, flat and skidded in. Mayers goes back and was hurried to play. Inside edges it onto his thigh pad
Harpreet Brar to Mayers, no run, fired flat onto middle, pushed back hard but straight towards Brar
Harpreet Brar to Mayers,  Caught!!

Harpreet Brar to Mayers,  Caught by Harpreet Singh!! Gone!! Harpreet Brar deserves this breakthrough. He kept Mayers quiet with a few dots balls, and then pushed a half tracker onto leg. Was there to be hit but Mayers gets it off the bottom of the bat on the pull and holes out to deep square leg. Nice low catch by the fielder running in from the fence.
Harpreet Brar to Hooda, no run, flighted up and spinning away, driven to short cover
A slip in place for the new batter
A slip in place for the new batter
Harpreet Brar to Hooda, 2 runs, tossed up, Hooda shimmies down and goes inside out. Didn't get it wide enough and Raza from long-off runs to his left to save a couple of runs
Rahul wasn't ready and backed away. Raza bowls it and knocks down the leg side. Both players hold out a hand in apology. We reload
Raza to Rahul, 2 runs, full and quick on off, Rahul slog sweeps across the line between deep mid-wicket and long-on. Nicely stopped by the mid-wicket fielder running and diving to his left
Raza to Rahul, , fired in flat on off, Rahul backed away and almost gave away his middle stump. Gets some bat on his cut and the ball takes a flying edge towards the third-man boundary
Raza to Rahul, 1 run, half tracker going down leg, was there to be smacked into the stands but Rahul pulls it towards backward square for just a single
Raza to Hooda,  Lbw!!

Raza to Hooda,  Lbw!! One wicket brings another!! This was a flat and straight ball onto middle, Hooda shuffled inwards for a big slog but completely misses the line and length. Struck bang in front of middle for one of the easiest LBW decisions the umpire has to give today.

PBKS are really doing a good job here despite their inexperience. And the irony that their most experienced player Rabada has actually been the one leaking runs. They kept Mayers quiet in the powerplay, and post that their spinners bowled some really tight lines. Brar got Mayers and now a returning Raza has picked up Hooda. LSG need a partnership, and one with an increase in strike rate would be helpful...
A slip in place for Pandya as well
Raza to Krunal Pandya, 1 run, pushed fuller on middle, driven towards long-on
Raza to Rahul, 1 run, short and spinning in, Rahul goes back to punch it towards long-on

Sam Curran to Rahul, , good length on off, skiddy delivery. Rahul expertly threads it between short third and backward point on the cut. Maybe Rabada at short third could have done better, but superb strokeplay from KL Rahul
Given how the run-rate has dipped, it seems that the pitch has started to slow down
Sam Curran to Rahul, 1 run, back of length onto off, cut towards point who half stops. Single taken
Sam Curran to Krunal Pandya, no run, good length and got some late away shape outside off. A play and a miss for Krunal Pandya as he gets beaten on the outside edge
Sam Curran to Krunal Pandya, , brilliant!! Short pitched and just outside off, Pandya with a shimmy inwards to pull it to the right of deep backward square leg. In the gap for a boundary...
Sam Curran to Krunal Pandya, , brilliant!! Short pitched and just outside off, Pandya with a shimmy inwards to pull it to the right of deep backward square leg. In the gap for a boundary...
Sam Curran to Krunal Pandya, no run, fuller on off, defended
Sam Curran to Krunal Pandya, 1 run, good length angling onto middle. Pandya gives Curran the charge and then punches towards mid-off for a single
Raza to Krunal Pandya, 1 run, fired in on middle, pushed towards mid-on for a single
LSG backed Kyle Mayers for performance and Punjab have gone for experience in Rabada inspite of good performances from Nathan Ellis. Two different approaches
Raza to Rahul, 2 runs, pushed fuller onto middle, turned towards deep mid-wicket for a couple of runs
Raza to Rahul, 1 run, shorter length and gets some extra bounce onto the thigh pad, Rahul blocks to the right of Raza for a single
Raza to Krunal Pandya, no run, seam up delivery outside off, Pandya goes for the cut and misses

Raza to Krunal Pandya, , leg byes, , that's the problem with Raza. Bowls five good balls and then skews one completely off the radar. This was an attempted yorker that goes down leg, deflects off the pads towards the fine leg boundary. And it is also a no ball...
Raza to Krunal Pandya, , flat and spinning away outside off. Pandya gets closer and chips it over point for a boundary. Well played!
Raza to Krunal Pandya, 1 run, slower and gets plenty of spin from off. Pandya dabs it behind square on the off side for a single
Rahul Chahar to Krunal Pandya, 1 run, shorter length and goes on with the angle. Pandya gave it a charge and adjusts to push it through covers for a single
Rahul Chahar to Rahul, 1 run, half tracker, hurried Rahul slightly who was late on the pull. Goes tamely towards deep mid-wicket
Rahul Chahar to Krunal Pandya, 1 run, pushed quicker and fuller on off. Pandya goes for the slog and underedges it towards deep backward square leg
Rahul Chahar to Rahul, 2 runs, short and wide, cut away just slightly to the left of sweeper cover. But that's enough for Rahul to come back on strike...
Rahul Chahar to Rahul, 1 run, flighted up, driven hard but straight towards deep cover
Rahul Chahar to Krunal Pandya, no run, full and straight, slightly quicker, driven back to Chahar
KL's lack of intent has been very surprising this season. Especially with all the explosive hitting surrounding him
With Stoinis, Pooran and Badoni to come, they have enough batting to finish the innings. With Pooran in such hot form, I don't understand why Krunal is batting ahead of all these players.
Arshdeep Singh to Rahul, no run, back of length angling onto off, has Rahul jumping to defend towards point
Arshdeep Singh to Rahul, , short of length again, Rahul backs away and slaps it over mid-on for a boundary. Finally a release shot from the LSG skipper, a rare show of aggresion!
Arshdeep Singh to Rahul, , short of length again, Rahul backs away and slaps it over mid-on for a boundary. Finally a release shot from the LSG skipper, a rare show of aggresion!
Arshdeep Singh to Rahul, 1 run, Arshdeep nails the yorker, Rahul jams it into the pitch and to the leg side
Arshdeep Singh to Krunal Pandya, 1 run, slower delivery, foxed Pandya who was way too early on his big drive. Uppish but tamely towards mid-wicket - safe with the fielders all deep
Arshdeep Singh to Rahul, no run, short pitched, was the bouncer and Rahul left it alone. Umpire says that's good enough, not too high
Arshdeep Singh to Rahul, 1 run, yorker on off from round the wicket, Rahul drives it square on the off side for a single
Rahul Chahar to Rahul, , a  loopy leg-break, well past the tramlines and the kepeer can't grab it cleanly either, rolls towards short third man and Krunal Pandya wanted a single, sent back by KL
Rahul Chahar to Rahul, , , loopy delivery on off, KL gets a good stride forward and then hammers the drive back over the bowler's head, bounces away straight of long-off, raises his fifty as well

Rahul Chahar to Rahul, no run, Chahar tosses one just outside off, was the leg-break - KL leant forward and then ran it towards short third man, wanted a single and is sent back, beats the throw with ease and the 3rd umpire has a look
Rahul Chahar to Rahul, no run, , a ripping leg-break, turn and bounce from off - draws KL forward and then rips past the outside edge
Rahul Chahar to Rahul, 1 run, dropped short by Chahar, KL rocks back and pulls it straight to deep mid-wicket, just a single
Rahul Chahar to Krunal Pandya, 1 run, flighted delivery outside off, Krunal comes down the pitch and drives it square past cover for a single
Rahul Chahar to Rahul, no run, flatter and at the stumps, KL backs away on the late dab, but he can't get it past Rabada at short third man
KG is back

Rabada to Krunal Pandya, 2 runs, top-edge and safe, banged in short by KG, Krunal was hurried onto the pull by the pace, gets a big edge that lobbed towards third man - a fumble by Rahul Chahar allows a second run

Debate about anchors and enforcers should not exist in the first place because any successful T20 team always has a mix of both. West indies and Pakistan are prime examples of having mostly enforcers or mostly anchors and we have seen how the former lacks consistency and the latter lacks firepower.
Rabada to Krunal Pandya,  Caught!!

Rabada to Krunal Pandya,  Caught by Shahrukh Khan!! Excellent grab by Shahrukh at deep mid-wicket and KG has struck on his comeback - was bowled short and at the stumps, Krunal rocked back and it made a cracking sound, and he was hitting it to the shorter boundary - Shahrukh was well placed inside the ropes, took the catch moving sideways, realised that he was going to trod onto the advertisement skirtings - lobbed the ball in the air, settled himself, came back and then took it on the rebound. The TV umpire has a few looks and he's happy that it's a clean catch - OUT is the signal on the big screen. An innings that was labouring around has ended.

Rabada to Pooran, , short of a good length and down the leg-side, Pooran was looking to flick and missed, called as a wide and  - did it brush Pooran's trousers on its way to the keeper? The ball is very close to the glove, UltraEdge in and there's a flat line. So the wide call stays and Punjab lose a review
Rabada to Pooran,  Caught!!

Rabada to Pooran,  Caught by Shahrukh Khan!! A first-ball duck for Pooran,m that's the roll of the dice goes in the IPL. Was the hero at the Chinnswamy, but could he have taken some time on this challenging surface? On a length and just outside off - Pooran was looking to heave it to the shorter boundary - dragged it slightly high on the bat, plenty of elevation and no real distance. A sitter for Shahrukh as he got under it at deep mid-wicket - LSG losing their way slightly here.

Rabada to Pooran,  Caught by Shahrukh Khan!! A first-ball duck for Pooran,m that's the roll of the dice goes in the IPL. Was the hero at the Chinnswamy, but could he have taken some time on this challenging surface? On a length and just outside off - Pooran was looking to heave it to the shorter boundary - dragged it slightly high on the bat, plenty of elevation and no real distance. A sitter for Shahrukh as he got under it at deep mid-wicket - LSG losing their way slightly here.
Rabada to Stoinis, no run, short of a good length and just outside off, Stoinis hops across defensively
Rabada to Stoinis, no run, fuller length delivery on the pads, clipped straight to the fielder at mid-wicket
Rabada to Stoinis, no run, the nip-backer from Rabada, asngled into the right-hander and beat Stoinis on the half-forward prod, off the thigh-pad and bounces through to the keeper

Tiime for the . The two quick wickets coudln't have come at a better time for the Kings, Lucknow were begnning to open up, but they've been pegged back once again. Anything around 160 could still be very competitive

Rahul Chahar not among wickets for PBKS, with Brar, Short and Raza giving spin options. I feel PBKS should try youngsters like Kaverappa in coming matches, there was so much talk about him before the season started
Rahul Chahar to Rahul, 1 run, the leg-break from Chahar, pushed through flatter and just outside off - KL backs away on the cut and mistimes it to the off-side
Rahul Chahar to Stoinis, no run, tossed up slower and just outside off, was the leg-break and Stoinis was swinging across the line, misses it completely

Rahul Chahar to Stoinis, , , another leg-break from Chahar, but this is a tad too full and allows Stoinis to get under it - played with the spin and gets enough elevation on the shot to clear long-off, who was pretty straight

Rahul Chahar to Stoinis, , back-to-back sixes for Stoinis - poor ball from Chahar, dropped short and Stoinis has plenty of time to rock back on the pull, he does so and powers it over mid-wicket for a maximum

Rahul Chahar to Stoinis, 1 run, good comeback from Chahar - went slower and wider with this leg-break, drew Stoinis into an ambitious drive and found the outside edge, looped high and dropped over the shoulder of the fielder running back from backward point

Rahul Chahar to Rahul, 1 run, , another slower delivery from Chahar, KL saw the width and went hard on the cut, gets a big top-edge that bounced agonizingly short of KG, who was diving forward at short third man
Rabada to Rahul, 2 runs, on a good length and angling into the right-hander, KL was early into the drive, off the inner half of the bat and lobbed through mid-wicket for a brace
Rabada to Rahul, 1 run, fuller length delivery on the pads, whipped away behind square on the on-side for a single
Rabada to Stoinis, 1 run, on a good length and at the stumps, Stoinis backs away and steers it to backward point for a single
Rabada to Rahul, , , innocous delivery from KG, width on offer and KL doesn't miss out, cuts it hard and over deep point for a maximum - was the shorter boundary and he cleared the leaping fielder

Rabada to Rahul, , banged in short and at the stumps, KL lets it go on height, but it's not called as a wide, , he's in a slightly crouched position, but since it's gone above his head, the 3rd umpire reckons it's a wide for height, so a good review from KL

Rabada to Rahul, 1 run, that'll go down as a half-chance, but KG hardly had time to react, on a length and just outside off, was flat-batted powerfully back at the bowler, hit KG on his knees even before he could react
Rabada to Stoinis, no run, nicely bowled, clever change of pace from KG - rolls his fingers across the seam on this slower ball, Stoinis spots it late and gets his bat down in time on the block
Rabada to Stoinis, no run, nicely bowled, clever change of pace from KG - rolls his fingers across the seam on this slower ball, Stoinis spots it late and gets his bat down in time on the block
Sam Curran to Rahul, no run, nicely bowled, fuller length delivery and well outside off, KL was backing away and lets it go, but it's well within the tramlines
Sam Curran to Rahul, 1 run, fuller length delivery outside off, drilled down towards long-off for a single
Sam Curran to Stoinis, 1 run, full and at the stumps, Stoinis shuffles across and whips it through mid-wicket for a single
Sam Curran to Rahul, , the bouncer from Curran, but it's way too short and too high, called as a wide
Sam Curran to Rahul, 1 run, slower ball angled across the right-hander - KL went hard on the drive and under-edged it to short third man for a single

Appeal for a  and . Curran was very confident, wasn't given as a wide either, did it flick the glove on its way to the keeper? The bat is close to the glove - onto UltraEdge and there's a spike when the ball is right next to the glove - it's a clear spike and the decision has to be reversed, Stoinis is OUT
Sam Curran to Stoinis,  Caught!!

Sam Curran to Stoinis,  Caught by Jitesh Sharma!! Appeal for a  and . Curran was very confident, wasn't given as a wide either, did it flick the glove on its way to the keeper? The bat is close to the glove - onto UltraEdge and there's a spike when the ball is right next to the glove - it's a clear spike and the decision has to be reversed, Stoinis is OUT. An unfortunate way to go and that could make a difference of at least 15-20 runs - short and down leg, Stoinis was looking to help it on its way with the pull and ends up getting strangled down the leg-side. Jitesh Sharma wasn't so sure, but the stand-in captain was and he earns a wicket for himself.
Sam Curran to Ayush Badoni, 1 run, short and into the wicket, Badoni swivels across and pulls it over square leg  for a single
Arshdeep Singh to Ayush Badoni, 1 run, short of a good length and just outside off, nudged back past the bowler for a single
Arshdeep Singh to Rahul, , , short and angling across the right-hander, KL sidesteps, gets inside the line and then ramps it over short third man for a boundary, can he get LSG to around 170?
Arshdeep Singh to Rahul, 2 runs, low full-toss from Arshdeep, was looking for the yorker, ficked to the right of long-on and KL is back for the second
Arshdeep, frm round the wicket
Arshdeep Singh to Rahul,  Caught!!

Arshdeep Singh to Rahul,  Caught by (sub)Nathan Ellis!! .. and he strikes with the angle, was the knuckle ball, was bowled into the surface and cramped KL for room on the shovel - hit very high on the bat and lobs a simple catch to Ellis, who is stationed at long-on. Punjab roaring back into the contest with timely wickets.
LSG have sent in their , it's Krishnappa Gowtham, replacing Kyle Mayers - Arshdeep, back to over the wicket
LSG have sent in their , it's Krishnappa Gowtham, replacing Kyle Mayers - Arshdeep, back to over the wicket
Arshdeep Singh to Gowtham, 1 run, short and bouncing into Gowtham's ribs, flicked away uppishly and down towards long leg for a single
Back to round the wicket
Arshdeep Singh to Ayush Badoni, leg byes, 1 run, shout for LBW, but it's a bit too high, angled in and struck Badoni high on the pads, he was hopping across as well, sneaks in a leg-bye
Sam Curran to Ayush Badoni, , Curran loses his line and spills one miles wide of off, called as a wide, was attempting the slower ball
Sam Curran to Ayush Badoni, no run, the perfect yorker from, Curran - full and just outside off, squeezes undernearth Badoni's bat as he drove
Sam Curran to Ayush Badoni, 1 run, slower short ball, was bowled into the surface and Badoni can only pull it to deep mid-wicket for a single
Sam Curran to Gowtham,  Caught!!

Sam Curran to Gowtham,  Caught by Raza!! The impact player has holed out to long-off, was bowled into the suface and was another slower ball - Gowtham was looking to force it away, hit low on the bat and spooned a dolly down to Raza at long-off - Punjab finishing on a high here.
Sam Curran to Yudhvir Singh,  Caught!!

Sam Curran to Yudhvir Singh,  Caught by Shahrukh Khan!! Another sharp catch at long-on and it's Shahrukh Khan once again. Was right in front of the ropes as he took the catch, he knew he was going to step onto the skirtings, lobs the ball up, goes over the ropes, comes back and then takes it on the rebound. But was his feet touching the rope as he completed the catch? The 3rd umpire is having several looks, he wants it to be zoomed and it's clear that he's not touched the rope - . Hard length doing the trick for Curran, was the slower short ball and Charak had to drag the pull, hit it straight and down to long-on.

Sam Curran to Ravi Bishnoi, 3 runs, fuller length delivery on off, Bishnoi clears his left leg and drives it past cover - Ellis runs across and then tries to make a one-handed pick-up, he fumbles and then has to run all the way back, slides and prevents the boundary, but they take an extra run

Sam Curran to Ayush Badoni, 2 runs, high full-toss outside off - Badoni swings hard and gets a top-edge over the bowler's head, scampers back for the second and . They actually reviewed for a possible no-ball for height, but it's deemed OK and  that'll end the innings

The Punjab Kings will take the momentum going into the dug-out. This isn't a straightforward pitch and as such 159 could still be a challenging score, especially with Dhawan not there, but they will take this score. KL Rahul anchored the innings with 74, but having batted half the overs, there'll be questions on his intent, not with Mayers though as he made the most of the powerplay, but the innings did get stuck when KL and Krunal were out in the middle. No heroics from Pooran and not much from Stoinis either, but on a dry wicket, they'll reckon they've the bowlers to defend this total. Three wickets for Sam Curran, the stand-in captain for the night, two for KG and the others chipped in. Shahrukh Khan was the star in the field and he reckons 'there's quite a lot of dew now'. Will that play into Punjab's hands? Back for the chase shortly..

The ball was following me a lot, but happy to come out well with those catches. I was told before the match to be at the shorter boundary because they needed taller players there. I think the wicket will get better to bat on because of the dew coming on. The ball was skidding on nicely when Sam was bowling. I reckon we need to bat smartly in the middle overs and take it deep, and then do well in the death overs.

Welcome back..  and he has replaced Rahul Chahar. A new opening combination with Atharva Taide opening on his IPL debut - Yudhvir Charak with the new ball, he's bowling from round the wicket - a slip in place
Yudhvir Singh to Atharva Taide, no run, short of a good length and climbing onto the left-hander, Taide wasn't on top of the bounce, but managed to drop it down
Yudhvir Singh to Atharva Taide, no run, short of a good length and climbing onto the left-hander, Taide wasn't on top of the bounce, but managed to drop it down
Yudhvir Singh to Atharva Taide, no run, short and wide of off, Taide throws his bat on the cut and missed
Yudhvir Singh to Atharva Taide,  Caught!!

Yudhvir Singh to Atharva Taide,  Caught by Avesh Khan!! A duck on debut for Taide and Yudhvir Singh is chuffed to bits. Nerves playing on Atharva's mind here - short of a length and angling into the left-hander, Atharva swung across the line, is through with the shot early and the big top-edge goes all the way to third man - Avesh runs in and completes a simple catch.
Yudhvir Singh to Short, 1 run, fuller length delivery on the pads, whipped down to long leg for a single
Yudhvir Singh to Prabhsimran, no run, back of a length and just outside off, Prabhsimran gets behind the line and defends it to the off-side
Yudhvir Singh to Prabhsimran, no run, fuller length delivery on off, Prabhsimran gets forward and pushes it to mid-off
Avesh Khan to Short, , , tad too short from Avesh, Short is quick to read the length, swivels across and then drills the pull past mid-wicket for a boundary
Avesh Khan to Short, no run, on a good length and just outside off, a semi-stride forward as Short pushes it to cover
Avesh Khan to Short, , , length ball angling into the pads, Short gets inside the line, brings his wrists into play and flicks it off his hips, behind square on the on-side for a boundary
Avesh Khan to Short, , , Short has started well, short of a good length and just outside off, he stands tall and then drives it on the rise, finds the gap square past point for a boundary
Avesh Khan to Short, no run, good comeback from Avesh, looked like the slower leg-cutter, kept coming back and burst past Short's inside edge, clipped his thigh on the way to the keeper

Avesh Khan to Short, no run, on a good length and angling back into the right-hander - Short looks slightly vulnerable to such deliveries, gets his bat down in time and squeezes an under-edge to the off-side, but you could see a massive bat-gap gap as he did so
Yudhvir Singh to Prabhsimran, , , banged in short by Yudhvir - Prabhsimran swivels across on the pull, didn't get it off the middle, but has enough for the ball to dribble away to the ropes
Yudhvir Singh to Prabhsimran,  Bowled!!

Yudhvir Singh to Prabhsimran,  Bowled!! An overambitious drive and Prabhsimran has lost his off-stump - on a good length and shaping back into the right-hander - Prabhsimran's feet hardly moved, he didn't account for rthe movement and then tried to drive it through cover. The ball goes right through the massive bat-pad gap and sends the off-stump cartwheeing. A dream LSG debut for Yudhvir, has accounted for both Punjab openers.
Yudhvir Singh to Harpreet Singh, leg byes, 1 run, short of a length and angling into the pads, clipped down to long leg for a single
Yudhvir Singh to Harpreet Singh, leg byes, 1 run, short of a length and angling into the pads, clipped down to long leg for a single
Yudhvir Singh to Short, no run, back of a length and just outside off, Short stands tall and finds mid-off with the back-foot punch
Impressive Start by Yudhvir in the first over, his line and lengths are on the money!!
Yudhvir Singh to Short, 1 run, on a good length and shaping back into trhe right-hander, Short was shaping for a big drive and squirts a thick inside edge, behind square on the on-side for a single
Yudhvir Singh to Harpreet Singh, , , fuller length delivery on the pads, Bhatia leans across and then whips it over mid-wicket, bounces away to the ropes in a hurry
Time for Mark Wood, a slip in place
Mark Wood to Short, 2 runs, fuller length delivery at , on the pads and it's flicked away behind square on the on-side for a couple of runs
Mark Wood to Short, 2 runs, short and at the stumps, , Short swivels across and pulls it in front of square on the on-side, comes back for the second
Mark Wood to Short, no run, fuller length delivery at , Short was pressing forward and gets a thick edge to backward point
Mark Wood to Short, no run, fuller length delivery at , driven straight to the fielder at mid-off
Mark Wood to Short, leg byes, 1 run, on a good length and angling into the pads at , Short was shaping for the flick and gets an inside edge onto the pad, rolled to the on-side for a single
Wood, from round the wicket
Mark Wood to Harpreet Singh, no run, short of a good length and angling into the left-hander, Harpreet Singh flicks and finds mis-wicket
Yudhvir Singh to Short, , , too short from Charak and the Australian doesn't miss out - stays on the front-foot and then powers the pull over mid-wicket for a bounbdary
Yudhvir Singh to Short, , , width on offer and Short climbs into the cut - gets on top of the bounce and lashes it square past cover, no one moved an inch
Yudhvir Singh to Short, 1 run, short of a good length and at the stumps, Short drags the pull past square leg for a single
Yudhvir Singh to Harpreet Singh, no run, Charak shortens the length around off, Bhatia hops across and defends it to the off-side
Yudhvir Singh to Harpreet Singh, no run, back of a length and angling across the left-hander - Bhatia rides the bounce, but his cut is weak and can't beat cover-point
Yudhvir Singh to Harpreet Singh, no run, on a good length and just outside off, steered with an open face to backward point
Gowtham to Short, no run, flighted delivery on off, went straight on and caught Short's leading edge on the flick, rolled to cover
Gowtham to Short, 1 run, flatter and at the stumps, eased down to long-on for a single
Gowtham to Harpreet Singh, 1 run, tossed up and sliding into the left-hander, Bhatia drops it in front of mid-wicket and they scamper across for a quick single
Gowtham to Short, , , tad too full from Gowtham, lets Short gets underneath the lofted drive and he then sends it soaring over long-on for a maximum
Gowtham to Short, no run, much better from Gowtham, drags the length back by a fdraction - Short leans forward and pushes it back at the bowler
KG, from round the wicket
Gowtham to Short,  Caught!!

Gowtham to Short,  Caught by Stoinis!! Oh dear! This is such a giveaway, no wonder Short looks so annoyed with himself - was tossed up around off and Short was looking to go inside out with the drive. But he hit it a lot straighter, went with hard hands and punched it straight down Stoinis's throat at mid-off, who reverse-cups it with ease. Short was looking so good once again, but his innings has been badly cut short.
Avesh Khan to Harpreet Singh, no run, short of a length and angling across the left-hander, Harpreet Singh has a poke at that and misses
Avesh Khan to Harpreet Singh, 1 run, back of a length and angling into the left-hander, Bhatia is slightly cramped for room on the cut, but he arches back and cuts it on the bounce to third man
Avesh Khan to Raza, no run, fuller length delivery and well wide of off, Raza has a good look and lets it go
Avesh Khan to Raza, no run, short of a good length and just outside off, Raza hops across and defends it to the off-side
Avesh Khan to Raza, 1 run, on a good length and angling into the right-hander, Raza prods across and squeezes it behind square on the on-side for a single
Avesh Khan to Harpreet Singh, 1 run, short and at the left-hander - Bhatia swivels across and pulls it over square leg for a single
Mark Wood to Harpreet Singh, 1 run, 142.6kph, back of a length around off, Harpreet arches back and ramps it in the air, almost carries to third man
Mark Wood to Harpreet Singh, 1 run, 142.6kph, back of a length around off, Harpreet arches back and ramps it in the air, almost carries to third man
Mark Wood to Raza, 1 run, 146kph, good length on middle, Raza hops back in defence and squirts it off a thick edge through backward point
Mark Wood to Harpreet Singh, 1 run, 140.6kph, back of a length just outside off, Harpreet leans back and punches through cover
Mark Wood to Raza, 2 runs, short of length just outside off, rushes onto Raza as he looks to pull, and he mistimes it down the ground. Still gets two for it as long-on has some ground to cover
Mark Wood to Raza, no run, 144.3kph, good length around off, Raza hangs back and blocks to cover
Mark Wood to Raza, no run, oh he steps away from the stumps! Wood follows him, goes back of a length at 147kph, and Raza tucks it to midwicket
Krunal brought on. Will start from round the wicket
Krunal Pandya to Harpreet Singh, 1 run, full across off, Harpreet drives to long-off
Krunal Pandya to Raza, no run, 100.6kph, flat on middle, it grips and turns off a length, and Raza defends watchfully from the crease
Krunal Pandya to Raza, 1 run, 97kph, speared in full at the stumps, Raza drives to long-on
Krunal Pandya to Harpreet Singh, , nicely done! 103kph, length ball sliding away outside off, and Harpreet waits for it before using the pace. He dabs it fine into the third man boundary for four
Krunal Pandya to Harpreet Singh, no run, Harpreet steps out looking to flick through midwicket, but isn't quite to the pitch of it. The leading edge pops up and falls short of Krunal
Krunal Pandya to Harpreet Singh, 2 runs, clipped through the gap at midwicket and he's back for two

Timeout! Harpreet and Raza have only been looking to rebuild so far with PBKS losing three wickets in the powerplay. Required rate is still manageable, so they can afford to take some time. But have to be careful about not letting it get out of control.
Very good chance for Raza to prove his calibre. We haven't seen his fireworks yet.

Gowtham to Raza, no run, Gowtham has one stump to aim at, he's 10 yards away, and he misses!  This is a flat length ball, Raza knocks it to the right of Gowtham in his followthrough, and then takes a few steps down looking for a single. Harpreet responds. But then Raza pulls out, leaving Harpreet stranded. There's no direct hit
Gowtham to Raza, 3 runs, darted in on leg, Raza nudges it off the pads through midwicket and they've done superbly to take three

Gowtham to Harpreet Singh, 1 run, dances down to the pitch of it and looks to go inside out with the lofted shot! Doesn't quite get it wide enough though. Was looking to go over extra cover, but long-off is able to cut it off

Gowtham to Raza, 2 runs, length ball darted into middle and leg, Raza again knocks it gently into the gap at midwicket. Long boundaries here, allowing them to get back for two when you play it in the pockets

Gowtham to Raza, 2 runs, length ball darted into middle and leg, Raza again knocks it gently into the gap at midwicket. Long boundaries here, allowing them to get back for two when you play it in the pockets
Gowtham to Raza, 1 run, pushed down to long-off for one
Gowtham to Harpreet Singh, no run, fired in full outside off, Harpreet pushes at it but
Krunal Pandya to Raza, 1 run, full ball on leg, Raza clears the front leg and drives to long-off
Krunal Pandya to Harpreet Singh, , flat length ball sliding across off, Harpreet makes room and slaps it over extra cover! They're looking to get a move on now
Krunal Pandya to Harpreet Singh, no run, fired into the pads at 93.4kph, Harpreet shimmies down and knocks it to midwicket

Krunal Pandya to Harpreet Singh, 1 run, 101.5kph, length ball around middle, Harpreet looks for a reverse-sweep but gets hit on the glove. There's an LBW appeal from Krunal which is turned down by the umpire

Krunal Pandya to Raza, 1 run, full outside off, Raza looks to hammer it over extra cover but there's turn for Krunal! We've seen this quite frequently that the ball is gripping despite the spinners firing it in. It takes a thick edge and goes to short third
Krunal Pandya to Harpreet Singh,  Caught!!

Krunal Pandya to Harpreet Singh,  Caught by Yudhvir Singh!! Harpreet looks to go big but Krunal fires it into the pads, denying him the swinging room. Harpreet still swipes across the line, hitting it straight to deep backward square. He was looking to take on the left-arm spinner in this over. Perishes in doing so.
Gowtham to Raza, no run, 97.3kph, flat length ball turning in on middle, Raza punches it back to Gowtham
Gowtham to Raza, no run, shimmies down, isn't quite to the pitch as Gowtham fires it in at 100.4kph, and then adjusts to defend it back
Gowtham to Raza, , steps out and whacks it for six! This time Raza is able to get close enough to the pitch of the delivery and goes through with the lofted hit down the ground
Gowtham to Raza, no run, backs to cut, the ball slides on off a length and he's beaten
Gowtham to Raza, no run, grips sharply after being darted in on a length around off. Raza goes back to pull, gets beaten, and is struck on the thigh
Gowtham to Raza, 1 run, pulled away to deep midwicket. Four dots in the over from Gowtham
Krunal Pandya to Raza, no run, full delivery fired in around leg, Raza clears the front leg and swings hard! But the ball almost turns square! It misses the edge and misses leg stump by a whisker

Krunal Pandya to Raza, , hasn't quite got hold of the pull, but he still clears Yudhvir at the boundary! Excellent effort from the debutant there as he jumps and tries to hold on, but his momentum takes him over. Was the short boundary at just 68 meters

Krunal Pandya to Raza, , another pull, and again he only just beats Yudhvir who gets a hand as he jumps full stretch but isn't able to flick it back! Tantalising stuff! Rahul not happy with Krunal dropping it on the shorter side. But Raza hasn't quite nailed his two pull shots either which have gone for sixes towards the short boundary

Krunal Pandya to Raza, , another pull, and again he only just beats Yudhvir who gets a hand as he jumps full stretch but isn't able to flick it back! Tantalising stuff! Rahul not happy with Krunal dropping it on the shorter side. But Raza hasn't quite nailed his two pull shots either which have gone for sixes towards the short boundary

Krunal Pandya to Raza, , would you believe it, again the pull shot only just evades Yudhvir! It's following him like a magnet! Pulled in the air, Yudhvir runs across to his left, dives but doesn't get a hand this time
Krunal Pandya to Raza, 1 run, fuller from Krunal, Raza looks to work across the line but gets a leading edge. It pops up in the air but is well wide of Krunal
Krunal Pandya to Sam Curran, no run, defended into the on-side
Gowtham to Raza, , excellent from Raza as there's a flurry of boundaries for PBKS! Fired in on a length around leg stump, Raza bends across, uses the pace and paddles it fine
Gowtham to Raza, no run, defended towards midwicket
Gowtham to Raza, , turning down the leg-side, Raza leaves it alone
Gowtham to Raza, 1 run, shimmies down and nudges it off the pads through midwicket as Gowtham fires it in
Gowtham to Sam Curran, 1 run, full ball fired in on middle and leg, Curran knocks it to long-on
Gowtham to Raza, 1 run, 99kph, flat length ball on middle, Raza tucks it off the back foot through midwicket

In hindsight, smart team selection from PBKS. To make up for Shikhar's absence, they've made sure they have a really long tail, they are four down and they still have Sam Curran, Shahrukh Khan, Jitesh Sharma, and Harpreet Brar to come in.
Gowtham to Sam Curran, 1 run, 98.2kph, flat length ball just outside off, Curran flat-bats it to long-off
Ravi Bishnoi to Sam Curran, no run, googly outside off, Curran looks to cut but misses
Ravi Bishnoi to Sam Curran, , now he connects! Another googly outside off, turns away off a length to give Curran width, and he slaps it over extra cover
Ravi Bishnoi to Sam Curran,  Caught!!

Ravi Bishnoi to Sam Curran,  Caught by Krunal Pandya!! Another googly outside off, Curran tries to go straighter this time, and he holes out at long-off. Probably should've gone over extra cover again as it was quite wide. But he tries a flat-batted shot down the ground and doesn't connect very well. Bishnoi celebrates with the star man pose.
Ravi Bishnoi to Jitesh Sharma, 1 run, pushed through flat on middle, skids on off a length and Jitesh pulls it to deep square leg
Ravi Bishnoi to Raza, no run, flat length ball around off, Raza gets forward and defends
Ravi Bishnoi to Raza, no run, flat length ball around off, Raza gets forward and defends

Ravi Bishnoi to Raza, 2 runs, oh a massive swing from Raza as he looks to heave it away! Flat length ball around off, Raza goes hard and mistimes it through square leg. It's gone in the gap and Raza is back for two
Mark Wood to Jitesh Sharma, no run, 140kph, good length around off, Jitesh hangs back and turns it to midwicket

Mark Wood to Jitesh Sharma, 1 run, oh midwicket is standing quite close to stop the single. If he was at the edge of the circle this would've been a dolly. Back of a length around middle, Jitesh looks to pull but it's too quick for him.

Mark Wood to Raza, , 144.6kph, short of length into the body, and Raza has played this beautifully! The ball isn't high enough to trouble him here! He swivels across, gets on top of the bounce and pulls it wide of fine leg

I don't understand the strategy being adopted by the captains, they are not utilizing a few bowlers until it is too late. Yesterday Shardul got only 1 over(5 balls) vs SRH even when other bowlers were leaking runs and the same with Bishnoi today.

Raza is gesturing that this bouncer went over his head. He has gone for a review after the umpire doesn't signal a wide. It's banged in short, Raza bends his head slightly, and the third umpire reckons it would've been over his head even if he was standing straight

Mark Wood to Raza, , Raza is gesturing that this bouncer went over his head. He has gone for a review after the umpire doesn't signal a wide. It's banged in short, Raza bends his head slightly, and the third umpire reckons it would've been over his head even if he was standing straight
Mark Wood to Raza, 1 run, sharp bouncer around head level, and Raza almost flinches as he pulls this through square leg. The single takes him to  - his first in the IPL
Mark Wood to Jitesh Sharma,  Caught!!

Mark Wood to Jitesh Sharma,  Caught by Rahul!!  He dives full stretch, goes with both hands, and just about clings on with his fingertips! Full and fast around off, Jitesh looks to drive but slices it wide of mid-off. It's going away from Rahul and he has some distance to cover as well before unleashing the dive. And he pulls it off!
Timeout! This game is in the balance. The asking rate is under 10, but PBKS do not have much batting left after Shahrukh. This is the pair for them

Mark Wood to Shahrukh Khan, , wow, just wow! To walk out and do that first ball to Mark Wood! Shahrukh Khan, are you for real! Speared in full just outside off, Shahrukh gets forward and smokes it over long-on. Oh what a hit!
What's happened here? LSG believe they've got Raza run out! But no they haven't. No they haven't. He's home by an inch!

Avesh Khan to Raza, 2 runs, what's happened here? LSG believe they've got Raza run out! But no they haven't. No they haven't.  Back of a length around off, Raza taps it through point, turns around for the second and puts in a full length dive
Avesh Khan to Raza, no run, cracking yorker outside off, Raza goes after it but is beaten
Avesh Khan to Raza, 1 run, Raza is filthy with himself! He smashes his bat onto pad after missing out on a full toss! Tried slogging it hard but mistimed it towards deep midwicket
Avesh Khan to Shahrukh Khan, 1 run, back of a length just outside off, Shahrukh steers it to deep point
Avesh Khan to Shahrukh Khan, 1 run, back of a length just outside off, Shahrukh steers it to deep point
Avesh Khan to Raza, no run, slower one around off, Raza bends across, no he falls across while trying to scoop. But misses. It bounces over the stumps on its way to the keeper
Avesh Khan to Raza, , way too wide outside off as Avesh looks to execute the wide yorker. He fails to keep it inside the marker and Raza leaves it alone

Avesh Khan to Raza, , drilled, absolutely drilled! Overpitched outside off as Avesh goes for another wide yorker, and Raza smashes the cover off it with a spanking drive through extra cover. It was Brook yesterday, and now it's Raza turn to announce his arrival after a few scratchy innings to start off
Ravi Bishnoi to Shahrukh Khan, no run, full delivery just outside off, Shahrukh looks to knock a single to long-on. But Bishnoi dives across and stops it

99kph, length ball sliding down leg, Shahrukh tries to paddle it fine but misses. Oh they've taken a review. Umpire had signalled a wide, but Pooran is convinced he got some bat/glove there. The review is for caught-behind. Let's wait for UltraEdge to find out what Pooran heard. There's nothing on it. Flat line throughout

Ravi Bishnoi to Shahrukh Khan, , 99kph, length ball sliding down leg, Shahrukh tries to paddle it fine but misses. Oh they've taken a review. Umpire had signalled a wide, but Pooran is convinced he got some bat/glove there. . Let's wait for UltraEdge to find out what Pooran heard. There's nothing on it. Flat line throughout
Ravi Bishnoi to Shahrukh Khan, no run, 98kph, fired in full around off, Shahrukh defends forward
Ravi Bishnoi to Shahrukh Khan, 1 run,  Googly on leg, Shahrukh miscues it in the air as he takes on the long boundary at deep midwicket. Falls well short of the fielder
Ravi Bishnoi to Raza, no run, 97.2kph, back of a length on middle, it's another googly that turns in sharply as Raza backs away. He looks to cut hard but is beaten. The ball wasn't far from leg stump
Ravi Bishnoi to Raza,  Caught!!

Ravi Bishnoi to Raza,  Caught by Stoinis!! What an over this is from Bishnoi to keep Lucknow alive! Just two runs off his first four balls, and now the wicket of Raza! The advantage he has is that the leg-side boundary is huge! Raza tries taking it on with the slog-sweep, doesn't connect well, and Stoinis charges in from deep backward square for a safe catch.
Ravi Bishnoi to Harpreet Brar, 1 run, brilliant from Bishnoi! 94kph, full around middle and leg, Harpreet gets forward and knocks it to long-on
So it's 20 needed off the last two overs. Shahrukh vs Wood, round 2. Oh hang on, it's Harpreet on strike
Mark Wood to Harpreet Brar, 1 run, back of a length on middle and leg, Harpreet tucks it behind square
Okay here we go now. Shahrukh against Wood. This could be the game right here.
Mark Wood to Shahrukh Khan, , way too wide! The idea might've been to go for a wide yorker, but Wood nearly sends it outside the pitch
Mark Wood to Shahrukh Khan, , way too wide! The idea might've been to go for a wide yorker, but Wood nearly sends it outside the pitch
Mark Wood to Shahrukh Khan, , way too wide! The idea might've been to go for a wide yorker, but Wood nearly sends it outside the pitch

Mark Wood to Shahrukh Khan, ,  Two balls against Wood, two sixes for Shahrukh! 143kph, short of length into the body, Shahrukh goes hard on the pull but it gets big on him before flying over the keeper's head

Mark Wood to Shahrukh Khan, ,  Two balls against Wood, two sixes for Shahrukh! 143kph, short of length into the body, Shahrukh goes hard on the pull but it gets big on him before flying over the keeper's head
Mark Wood to Shahrukh Khan, 1 run, 147kph, full and wide, not quite in the blockhole. Shahrukh swings hard, loses his shape and drags it off a thick inside edge behind square
Mark Wood to Shahrukh Khan, 1 run, 147kph, full and wide, not quite in the blockhole. Shahrukh swings hard, loses his shape and drags it off a thick inside edge behind square

Mark Wood to Harpreet Brar, , this is some treatment Wood is getting. Harpreet Brar, you beauty! He steps away from the stumps, Wood tries following him with a full delivery at 148kph. But he ends up offering a half-volley which is crashed through extra cover

Mark Wood to Harpreet Brar, , this is some treatment Wood is getting. Harpreet Brar, you beauty! He steps away from the stumps, Wood tries following him with a full delivery at 148kph. But he ends up offering a half-volley which is crashed through extra cover
Mark Wood to Harpreet Brar,  Caught!!
Mark Wood to Harpreet Brar,  Caught!!

Mark Wood to Harpreet Brar,  Caught by Pooran!! Wood strikes back, PBKS eight down! Harpreet backs away again, gets a length ball angled into him at 147kph and swings across the line. But all he can do is nick it to the keeper. Oh these games just refuse to be without drama.

Mark Wood to Harpreet Brar,  Caught by Pooran!! Wood strikes back, PBKS eight down! Harpreet backs away again, gets a length ball angled into him at 147kph and swings across the line. But all he can do is nick it to the keeper. Oh these games just refuse to be without drama.
Mark Wood to Rabada, no run, 150.6kph, hard length at the stumps, Rabada tries making room for a flat-batted slap. But it's onto him too quickly, and he mistimes it back to Wood
Mark Wood to Rabada, no run, 150.6kph, hard length at the stumps, Rabada tries making room for a flat-batted slap. But it's onto him too quickly, and he mistimes it back to Wood
Bishnoi trusted with the final over, and why not
Bishnoi trusted with the final over, and why not
Ravi Bishnoi to Shahrukh Khan, 2 runs, goes for a slog-sweep, hits it well but not well enough to clear the long boundary at midwicket. It's wide of the fielder though, and Shahrukh is back for two
Ravi Bishnoi to Shahrukh Khan, 2 runs, goes for a slog-sweep, hits it well but not well enough to clear the long boundary at midwicket. It's wide of the fielder though, and Shahrukh is back for two

Ravi Bishnoi to Shahrukh Khan, 2 runs, this is never going to carry, but Hooda still tries his best at long-on! Flat googly that turns in off a length, Shahrukh gets it high on the bat as he slogs hard and miscues it in the air. Falls short of Hooda

Ravi Bishnoi to Shahrukh Khan, , that's it,  What a knock this has been! And Bishnoi, who did such a great job to keep his team in the game, finally gets it slightly wrong. He bowls this too full outside off, and Shahrukh hammers it wide of long-off to seal the win

What's with IPL 2023, seriously! New day, new heroes and another cracker of a game! Batting has been Punjab's weaker suit, and again they struggled today while chasing a target that wasn't very daunting. But a fifty from Sikandar Raza turned it on for them at the right time. His takedown of Krunal Pandya got the rate well within reach, and then Shahrukh Khan, who took some lovely catches earlier in the evening, stepped up in the death overs to get them over the line. The way he started his little cameo, with a six first ball off Mark Wood, was a good indication that he was on tonight. And despite Bishnoi doing a terrific job to keep Lucknow in the game, it wasn't enough. There was heavy dew on the outfield, as Shahrukh himself verified during the mid-innings break, and that made Lucknow's job quite hard as well. But again, their approach through those middle overs with the bat was debatable to say the least as they finished with just 159.

We were about 10 short, the dew came in and helped the batters a bit more. We didnt do too well with the ball. (On what is a par score here) When your'e playing on a new pitch, you cant rely on previous games so we are taking it as it comes. Assessing it as it comes to think what would be a par total. If a few guys get going, we can get that 180-190 mark like Mayers and Pooran played well in that DC game, but unfortunately today a few batters got caught on the boundary lines. If they went over, the score could have been different. Part of the game, we learn from it. (On his diving catch) Game on the line, you have to give it everything on the field. I saw the ball and went for it. (On finding balance between aggression and anchoring) Each player has a different role, we are 7-8 batters in our team and few are powerful enough to clear every boundary, the others have different skills. We each play our role and thats what makes the team exciting. We have power in Pooran and Stoin, and Mayers up top takes the aggressive route. For each player taking that aggressive route can look different, you have to stick to what works best for you.

- Really feeling good, after the first innings,. it was important to play a par game (in the chase). Raza played superbly and set it up for me. My mindset was just to stay with the ball, the practice is working out to me. I'm powerful, cheeky shots don't work for me, so I try to hit straight and it's good to use my muscles. I just told Brar to go for the big hit since it was the last (5th) ball of the over, unfortunately he got out, but I was confident I could finish in the last over.

Amazing win. I thought our spinners bowled nicely. KG does what he does. Bit of dew came in but the wicket was offering a little for the bowlers. The way Sikandar Raza played was brilliant. And the way Shahrukh finished it, that's what he's in our team to do. His role has been clear in our side. Players who can hit sixes from ball one are dangerous. You go from ground to ground - different dimensions - have to come up with different gameplans. We've got so many options which is lovely to have as a captain. I've never done it before. Hopefully Shikhar is fit soon.

Feels great to be honest. When I got out, there were a few demons in my head. Credit to Shahrukh. Nice to get a fifty but if we had lost, I wouldn't have felt so good. It's one of the biggest stage. You're here and you want to do well. I've had two average games which was there in my head. Jitesh's wicket was very crucial. Had he stayed on for 6-8 balls, he would've finished the game himself. But the way Shahrukh came out hitting his first ball for six, I was confident in him.

So who wants to talk about KL Rahul's strike rate? The pitch might've been different before the dew came in, but with such potential in that Lucknow middle order, this particular approach might just be selling them short. They certainly didn't have enough on the board today. Anyway that's it from us. Thanks to all of you for chipping in with your comments. Hope you enjoyed our coverage. This is Sagar Chawla signing off on behalf of Pradeep Krishnamurthy, Venky, and Saurabh Shankar. Goodnight!
